System posting queue¶

CONTACT Elements generates system postings for the activities automatically, depending on the configuration. The postings must be assigned to individual topics. For example, the posting that a job is finished is assigned to the project to which the job belongs. Since assigning these topics can be potentially labor-intensive, they are not assigned directly in the process of the user who carries out the activity that generates the posting. Instead, a posting job is created that is processed by this service.

The jobs that are not completed can be looked up under Administration/Configuration ‣ Activities ‣ System Posting Jobs.

Administration of the service¶

The service is configured for completing the job queue via the service configuration (see servicedaemon-config) for the service cs.activitystream.service.SystemPostingQueue. In general, this service can run on every computer that can connect to the database. Since the service derives from a general message queue implementation, it does not only have the parameters specified below.

Service parameters

--timeout <time>¶

The value of this option defines the time span without interaction with a client after which the service is stopped. The default is 0 seconds, which means that the service is never stopped.

--user <login>¶

The login for the CONTACT Elements user whose account the process should be operating. The user who has been prepared exactly for this case has the login aspostingqueue. The necessary licences are assigned automatically to this user via the general role System Posting Queue Service.
